title: Current Opioid Misuse Measure (COMM)
description: Identifies potential medication misuse in patients who are on long-term opioid therapy. The COMM is a validated self-report instrument for identifying and monitoring opioid misuse in chronic pain patients taking prescription opioids for pain management.

parameters.name: thinking_clearly
parameters.description: In the past 30 days, have you had trouble thinking clearly or memory problems?

parameters.name: not_completing_tasks
parameters.description: In the past 30 days, have people complained that you are not completing necessary tasks?

parameters.name: relief_other_sources
parameters.description: In the past 30 days, have you tried to get pain relief from sources other than your prescribing physician?

parameters.name: taking_differently
parameters.description: In the past 30 days, have you taken your medications differently than prescribed?

parameters.name: thinking_hurting_self
parameters.description: In the past 30 days, have you seriously thought about hurting yourself?

parameters.name: time_thinking_medications
parameters.description: In the past 30 days, how much time have you spent thinking about opioid medications?

parameters.name: being_in_arguments
parameters.description: In the past 30 days, have you been in arguments?

parameters.name: trouble_controlling_anger
parameters.description: In the past 30 days, have you had trouble controlling anger?

parameters.name: need_medications_from_others
parameters.description: In the past 30 days, have you had to take pain medications from someone else?

parameters.name: worried_handling_medications
parameters.description: In the past 30 days, have you been worried about how you are handling your medications?

parameters.name: others_worried_handling
parameters.description: In the past 30 days, have others been worried about how you are handling your medications?

parameters.name: emergency_clinic_visits
parameters.description: In the past 30 days, have you made emergency clinic calls or visits?

parameters.name: getting_angry_with_people
parameters.description: In the past 30 days, have you gotten angry with people?

parameters.name: taking_more_than_prescribed
parameters.description: In the past 30 days, have you taken more medication than prescribed?

parameters.name: borrowing_pain_medication
parameters.description: In the past 30 days, have you borrowed pain medication from others?

parameters.name: using_for_non_pain_symptoms
parameters.description: In the past 30 days, have you used pain medicine for symptoms other than pain?

parameters.name: visiting_emergency_room
parameters.description: In the past 30 days, have you visited the Emergency Room?

result.name: comm_assessment
result.description: COMM assessment with total score and risk categorization for opioid misuse

ranges.interpretation: Score below threshold indicates low risk for current opioid misuse. Continue standard monitoring and pain management protocols.

ranges.description: Possible misuse or abuse of medications
ranges.interpretation: Score at or above threshold suggests possible opioid misuse. Further evaluation and enhanced monitoring recommended. Consider substance abuse consultation.

clinical_applications: Screening for opioid misuse in chronic pain patients
Monitoring patients on long-term opioid therapy
Risk assessment for aberrant drug-related behaviors
Clinical decision support for opioid prescribing
Quality improvement in pain management programs
Research on opioid misuse and addiction
references: Butler SF, Budman SH, Fernandez KC, et al. Development and validation of the Current Opioid Misuse Measure. Pain. 2007;130(1-2):144-156. doi: 10.1016/j.pain.2007.01.014.

Butler SF, Budman SH, Fanciullo GJ, Jamison RN. Cross validation of the Current Opioid Misuse Measure to monitor chronic pain patients on opioid therapy. Clin J Pain. 2010;26(9):770-776. doi: 10.1097/AJP.0b013e3181f195ba.

Meltzer EC, Rybin D, Saitz R, et al. Identifying prescription opioid use disorder in primary care: diagnostic characteristics of the Current Opioid Misuse Measure (COMM). Pain. 2011;152(2):397-402. doi: 10.1016/j.pain.2010.11.006.
Butler SF, Budman SH, Fanciullo GJ, Jamison RN. Development of a Brief Version of the Current Opioid Misuse Measure (COMM): The COMM-9. Pain Med. 2019;20(1):113-118. doi: 10.1093/pm/pny022.
formula: Total Score = Sum of all 17 item responses (each scored 0-4 points)
notes: Cut-off score of ≥9 indicates possible opioid misuse
Designed for patients already on long-term opioid therapy
Should be administered by healthcare professionals
Not intended as a diagnostic tool for opioid use disorder
May have false positives and should be combined with clinical judgment
A shorter 9-item version (COMM-9) is also available
Self-report instrument with excellent internal reliability (α = .86)

validation.population: Chronic pain patients on long-term opioid therapy
